column4: i have an ext3 filesystem that comes up with errors every time it boots and i cant figure out how to fix it
if you are taken to a recovery console, then just type fsck and let it run
i tried ... it ran and fixed some things
it came up with a console again ... i tried fsck and it said that it was dangerous to run fsck on a mounted fs
it told me it was starting a recovery console
weird, you can try doing fsck from a LiveCD
hrmm thats an idea, ill try that out
yeah im not a linux nub ... i just have never had an fs that would not fix itself
yeah, I suggest backing up, if you're getting fsck issues twice in a row, it may be your HDD
